item.title: ClaudIO Agentic Data Management Presented at SC25
item.description: Dr. Kyle Chard presents ClaudIO's autonomous data management at Supercomputing 2025
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Kyle Chard presented IOWarp's ClaudIO autonomous agent at SC25 (Supercomputing 2025) in Denver, Colorado.

Presentation Highlights​

  • ClaudIO's autonomous data management capabilities
  • 7.5x performance improvements in seismology workflows
  • Integration with national lab HPC systems
  • Live demonstration of natural language data queries

Resources​

  • Conference website: SC25
  • Presentation slides: Coming soon
  • Related paper: Context Engineering for Autonomous Workflows

Impact​

ClaudIO represents a paradigm shift in how scientists interact with HPC data infrastructure, eliminating the need for manual scripting and enabling natural language driven analysis.

item.title: 15 MCP Servers Now Available via uvx
item.description: Install IOWarp MCP servers instantly with uvx - zero configuration required
item.content:encoded:
All 15 IOWarp MCP servers are now available for instant installation via uvx - no configuration required.

Available Servers​

Scientific Data Formats:

  • HDF5 - Hierarchical data analysis
  • ADIOS - Parallel I/O workflows
  • NetCDF - Climate and weather data
  • Darshan - I/O profiling and analysis

HPC Infrastructure:

  • Slurm - Job scheduling and management
  • PBS - Workload management
  • Jarvis - Resource orchestration

Data Processing:

  • Pandas - Dataframe operations
  • NumPy - Array computations
  • SciPy - Scientific computing

Research Tools:

  • ArXiv - Paper search and retrieval
  • PubMed - Scientific literature
  • Zenodo - Research data repository

Visualization:

  • ParaView - 3D scientific visualization
  • Matplotlib - Plotting and charts

Installation​

# Install any MCP server instantly:
uvx iowarp-mcps hdf5
uvx iowarp-mcps slurm
uvx iowarp-mcps pandas

# Install multiple at once:
uvx iowarp-mcps hdf5 slurm pandas arxiv

Works with Claude Code, Cursor, VS Code, and any MCP-compatible client.

Get started now →

item.title: Dr. Maria Garcia Joins IOWarp as Postdoctoral Researcher
item.description: Dr. Garcia brings expertise in ML-driven storage optimization to IOWarp
item.content:encoded:
We're excited to welcome Dr. Maria Garcia to the IOWarp team as a Postdoctoral Researcher at Gnosis Research Center, Illinois Institute of Technology.

Background​

Dr. Garcia completed her PhD in Computer Science at Stanford University, where her dissertation focused on machine learning techniques for intelligent data placement in heterogeneous storage systems.

Research Focus at IOWarp​

At IOWarp, Dr. Garcia will work on:

  • ML-driven context prefetching in the Context Transfer Engine (CTE)
  • Intelligent data tiering strategies for massive scientific datasets
  • Predictive models for agent data access patterns
  • Performance optimization for multi-agent workflows

Welcome!​

Please join us in welcoming Dr. Garcia to the IOWarp family. She'll be presenting her research plans at our next community call.

Learn more about our team →

item.title: IOWarp Deployed at NERSC for Climate Modeling
item.description: NERSC adopts IOWarp for climate simulation data workflows
item.content:encoded:
The National Energy Research Scientific Computing Center (NERSC) has deployed IOWarp to accelerate climate modeling data workflows.

Deployment Details​

NERSC's climate modeling team is using IOWarp to:

  • Orchestrate context for massive NetCDF climate datasets
  • Enable AI-driven analysis of simulation outputs
  • Reduce data preparation time from hours to minutes
  • Support autonomous agent exploration of climate archives

Impact​

Initial benchmarks show:

  • 5x faster data preparation for ML training
  • 80% reduction in manual scripting time
  • Seamless integration with existing Slurm workflows
  • Natural language queries replacing complex CDO/NCO commands

Technology Stack​

  • Storage Layer: NERSC's Perlmutter parallel file system
  • Compute: CPU and GPU nodes via Slurm integration
  • MCPs: NetCDF, HDF5, Slurm, Pandas
  • Agent: ClaudIO with climate domain knowledge

Read more about NERSC →

item.title: $5M NSF Grant Awarded to IOWarp Project
item.description: IOWarp receives $5M NSF grant for context engineering research (2024-2029)
item.content:encoded:
We're thrilled to announce that IOWarp has been awarded a $5 million grant from the National Science Foundation (Award #2411318) for the period 2024-2029.

This significant investment will enable us to:

  • Advance context engineering research for agentic AI
  • Deploy IOWarp at additional national laboratories
  • Expand our scientific MCP ecosystem
  • Build the community and documentation

We're grateful to NSF for this support and excited about the next phase of the project!

Partners: University of Utah, The HDF Group Timeline: 2024-2029 Focus Areas: Context orchestration, multi-agent coordination, HPC-AI convergence

item.title: IOWarp Paper Accepted to HPDC 2025
item.description: Context Engineering for Autonomous Scientific Workflows paper accepted to HPDC 2025
item.content:encoded:
Our paper "Context Engineering for Autonomous Scientific Workflows" has been accepted to the 34th International Symposium on High-Performance Parallel and Distributed Computing (HPDC 2025).

Paper Abstract​

This paper introduces context engineering as a new paradigm for enabling autonomous AI agents in scientific computing environments. We present the IOWarp platform's three-layer architecture and demonstrate 7.5x performance improvements in seismology analysis workflows.

Authors​

  • Alex Kougkas (Illinois Institute of Technology)
  • Kyle Chard (University of Chicago / Argonne National Laboratory)
  • [Additional authors TBD]

Conference Details​

  • Event: HPDC 2025
  • Location: Pisa, Italy
  • Date: June 2025
  • Track: Data-Intensive Systems

The paper will be presented by Alex Kougkas. Pre-print coming soon on arXiv.

item.title: University of Utah Partnership for National Data Platform
item.description: IOWarp partners with Utah's NDP project for federated data infrastructure
item.content:encoded:
IOWarp announces partnership with University of Utah's National Data Platform (NDP) project led by Dr. Manish Parashar.

This collaboration will integrate IOWarp's context orchestration capabilities with NDP's federated data infrastructure, enabling seamless data access across national research facilities.

Focus Areas:

  • EarthScope seismology data integration
  • Cross-facility data orchestration
  • Agent-driven data discovery

Learn more about NDP: https://ndp.utah.edu

item.title: IOWarp Beta Release Now Available
item.description: First public beta of IOWarp with 15 MCP servers and ClaudIO agent
item.content:encoded:
IOWarp Beta is now available on GitHub! This release includes core platform components and initial MCP implementations.

What's Included​

  • Content Assimilation Engine (CAE)
  • Content Transfer Engine (CTE)
  • Content Exploration Interface (CEI) - Natural language agent interface
  • Platform Plugins Interface (PPI)
  • MCPs: Adios, HDF5, Slurm, Jarvis, ParaView

Get Started​

pip install iowarp
iowarp demo seismology

Feedback Welcome​

Try it out and let us know what you think on Zulip or GitHub Discussions.
